@ stylish
Question: Why mess with the quality of the source video at all? If the source video is from the Bluray then isnt the video quality already at its desired level intended by the filmmakers? 

This was one of the many points for bringing widescreen format to home entertainment, to display the movie as intended by the filmmakers.

Just seems pointless to change the visual of the movie into your liking instead of the way it was meant to be seen. IMHO thats like taking the movie Dark City and saying to yourself "ya know this movie could be brighter, would bring out a lot of details in the background." Just sounds idiotic. 

Lastly this has nothing to do with the fact you uploaded multiple copies i could careless about that.
